ok, I talked enough, lets get to the solution. Open Applications->Accessories->Passwords and Encryption Keys
select Edit->Preferences
click on the keyring "login" and choose the button "change Unlcok Password"
ok?
now, enter your password in the "old password" field and click change, without entering a new password.
probably a warning will occur, that this is insecure.
yeah, so just click "ok" in that warning.
ok, you're all set now. no passwords anymore
but remember: everybody with access to your files can also read your saved passwords (that are saved in the keyring), like your wlan password. Glad to have helped, zoed
